summary: Things that relieved me during episode 1: Sansa’s apology to Tyrion being borderline sarcastic and not about her self...
question: Things that relieved me during episode 1: Sansa’s apology to Tyrion being borderline sarcastic and not about her self deprecating Bran emoting when he reunited with Jon Theon being badass and then going north, meaning he’s reuniting with Sansa  Sansa Snark first of her name  Jon at least visibly not being comfortable on the dragon  Tyrion getting called out on all his shit, from the eunuch jokes to trusting Cersei  The fact that Jon not only said but emphasized to Dany how pretty his sister is
answer: I don’t think her apology was sarcastic, I think she was sincere, but at the same time, I don’t think that’s a bad thing. Look, if Sansa had apologized to Tyrion for being a ‘’bad child bride’’, I would’ve have thrown hands, however, she apologized for making an extremely reasonable decision that just happened to endanger him, and she, being the good and empathetic person that she is, felt bad about it. I did like her criticizing Tyrion for his blind faith in Cersei as well. That was really sastifying to watch.  Bran definitely developed a wider array of emotions. It’s not radically different, but it’s a positive change. Theon absolutely killed it this episode, and seeing him wanting to help fight for the Starks, who are his family, after all that happened, makes me so proud and emotional. It’s no surprise that Jon isn’t quite comfortable on the decision, it’s his first time. That being said, unlike Theon, Jon only grew and lived with the Starks. His identity revolves around the North and the Starks, and so when faced with a choice, he’s going to choose the only side that ever really mattered to him. There’s also Arya, who really surprised me this episode. Not in terms of siding with Sansa, but in terms of feeling so human this episode. She wasn’t just the emotionless killing machine the show pushed her to be last season. Seeing her smile, laugh, make jokes and flirt in this episode really great to see. Made me remember why I liked her so much in the first six seasons when I first watched the show. So yeah, the Starks are doing all right. Love that for them.

tags: i'm so confused at the all sansa-robb and sansa-arya content when sansa-bran is more loving
summary: How was the relationship b/w Sansa & bran like? Can it be compared to Arya/Jon? Who was S closest to out of all her siblings?
question: How was the relationship b/w Sansa & bran like? Can it be compared to Arya/Jon? Who was S closest to out of all her siblings?
answer: Sansa and Bran are very similar and their arcs mirror each other. Bran was the only person who shared Sansa’s interests and who never thought they were stupid or irritating (except the kissing songs but Bran thought they were stupid, not Sansa). While they grew apart as they grew older because they were being prepped for their future roles, there was a lot of love between them. Sansa was definitely closer to Bran than any of her other siblings and their relationship was wholly positive. In AGOT they each showed concern for one another with Sansa crying a lot because of Bran’s near death experience and Bran realising that Sansa was unprotected in King’s Landing (meanwhile Robb was furious at the Sansa wrote not realising that she coerced into writing it) Bran was the only Starkling who wanted to rescue Sansa

summary: Do you subscribe to the theory that the rising of the WW threat after thousands of years was a result of the dragons being born?...
question: Do you subscribe to the theory that the rising of the WW threat after thousands of years was a result of the dragons being born? Like the ice threat rising is a result of the fire threat rising too idk how to explain lol but this could be the reason why Bran is choosing to reveal Jon’s parentage right NOW and nudging him towards the throne, it’s almost like he’s trying to set up Jon against D, maybe all it takes for the NK to go away is for the dragons to die..{1/2}
answer:
{2/2} i think people need to pay more attention to Bran, since he’s the key to ending the NK threat so everything he does, he does it for a reason, choosing to reveal jon’s parentage now of all times…. how will it help in defeating the NK?

I think it’s hard to tell what caused the Night King to start the apocalypse. Maybe the magic that kept him away weakened or maybe he foresaw Westeros being destroyed by a massive civil war. Either way Craster has been giving him children for many years so NK started building his strength before Dany hatched her eggs. I think both threats are happening at the same time is an awful coincidence.

If I had to guess I would say the Starks abandoning Winterfell was the trigger that NK saw before it happened. ‘There must always be a Stark in Winterfell’ is mantra that might mean there must always be a Stark ready to defend humanity. This time that Stark is Bran, it’s why he was the last Stark to leave Winterfell. When he left, he went right into NK’s territory and he ended up learning how to defeat him at a great cost. Bran lost his friends and then he lost himself, in the end the sacrifice will be worth it

title: Honestly
body:
Bran is clearly waiting for Theon to give him the “Water under the bridge, bro. Welcome home!” speech from the trailer. How is that not common wisdom by now? Does no one remember the books (I know they’ve come out very long ago, but still) and how Bran desperately tries to communicate with Theon through trees and crows? He needs to talk to his old friend Theon! Just cause Jamie arrives earlier, doesn’t mean he was Bran’s focus.

Btw, so Theon was importantly featured in the trailer, just invisibly for minimum spoilers.
